properties.areaDesc: Crawford, MO; Madison, IL; Montgomery, MO; Jefferson, MO; Callaway, MO; Monroe, IL; St. Louis City, MO; Lincoln, MO; Greene, IL; St. Louis, MO; Jersey, IL; Franklin, MO; Gasconade, MO; Osage, MO; Calhoun, IL; St. Charles, MO; Iron, MO; Cole, MO; Warren, MO; Washington, MO
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 12:29PM CST until January 12 at 12:30PM CST by NWS St Louis MO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a

* Flood Warning for...
Southern Greene County in southwestern Illinois...
Western Monroe County in southwestern Illinois...
Southeastern Calhoun County in southwestern Illinois...
Western Madison County in southwestern Illinois...
Jersey County in southwestern Illinois...
St. Charles County in east central Missouri...
Crawford County in east central Missouri...
Jefferson County in east central Missouri...
Lincoln County in east central Missouri...
Montgomery County in east central Missouri...
Southeastern Callaway County in central Missouri...
Southeastern Cole County in central Missouri...
St. Louis City in east central Missouri...
Northwestern Iron County in southeastern Missouri...
Washington County in east central Missouri...
Franklin County in east central Missouri...
St. Louis County in east central Missouri...
Osage County in central Missouri...
Warren County in east central Missouri...
Gasconade County in east central Missouri...

* Until 1230 PM CST Sunday.

* At 1226 PM CST, local officials and the Department of
Transporation indicated a some roads across the region were
covered with high water and either impassable or closed. This
flooding was the result of 3 to 6 inches of rain which fell across
the region.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
St. Louis, O'Fallon, St. Charles, St. Peters, Florissant,
Chesterfield, Wildwood, University City, Ballwin, Wentzville,
Kirkwood, Maryland Heights, Hazelwood, Webster Groves, Ferguson,
Arnold, Manchester, Godfrey, Creve Coeur and Overland.

This also includes Babler Memorial State Park, Washington State
Park, Scott Joplin Historic Site, Route 66 State Park, Onondaga Cave
State Park, Deutschheim Historic Site, Cuivre River State Park,
Castlewood State Park, Confluence State Park, Mastodon Historic
Site, Dillard Mill Historic Site, Sandy Creek Covered Bridge
Historic Site, Gov. Dunklin's Grave Historic Site, Graham Cave State
Park, First Missouri State Capitol Historic Site, Robertsville State
Park, Meramec State Park, and Pere Marquette State Park.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.
